reviews.text: My first experience at this wonderful institution, but most certainly not the last! It was a long drive, but well worth making a day out of it. Come early; otherwise, the lines will be long! A lot of people brought their children, and there was even an area specifically for them. The cafeteria area had good food and (most importantly) coffee--I think I had 3 or so flavors to choose from. The butterflies were, of course, one of the most popular attractions; a must see.

We have gone to see butterflies for 10 years. We love it and so do the kids. Worth the price. Very nice inside but always busy at butterfly time. Expect a super long line if your not early. Even if you are expect to walk from your parking spot. Even handicap is a hike. But everyone is always friendly. A great day trip.

Have lived in West Michigan almost all my life and barely came visit.. it is beautiful. So excited for the renovations coming soon. Its a great place to bring family and friends. From outside it looks small but there is more that plenty of space to walk around. Definitely coming back.

We love the children's garden and play area. The gardens have continuously changing exhibits allowing repeat visits to be equally rewarding. Wonderful place to spend the afternoon walking about. The staff is amazing. They are knowledgeable about the plants and exhibits and love sharing the history of the Meijer family.

Absolutely stunning gardens! This particular visit was for the butterfly exhibit in the spring . What a great way to escape the winter doldrums by wandering through the tropical forest setting with thousands of beautiful butterflies and some tropical birds flutter about. We were fortunate to go on a pretty fair spring day, making it possible to bring the kids to play at the fantastic children's garden, complete with a story time. Fun for all, our group of  6 ranging in ages from 2-58! Thanks!

Really enjoyed this museum,  much better picture of Gerald Ford than I remember from my youth. Loved the Oval Office replica and the chance to sit  in the President's chair in the cabinet room. Did a pretty thorough job and it took about 4 hours. Free parking directly in front of the museum. Google maps shows a parking garage that is a good block away and $8.00 for the day so don't get confused.  That's where to park if the free lot is full.

The Gerald R. Ford Presidential Museum in Grand Rapids, Michigan is so well done. They have documented his life with so many details. Lots of memorabilia from his childhood... his high school years... his college years... his time in the Navy... and all of his years in the Congress... Vice Presidency... and his time as President. There is also a lot of memorabilia about Betty Ford. The entire museum is very interesting. We spent about 3 hours in the museum... and could have been there longer. There is so much to see. If you love history.. this is a wonderful place to spend a few hours.

A really interesting museum that sheds some intriguing light on politics and the inner workings of the White House. Having never been to a presidential museum, I don't know how others compare. But the Ford museum was very well laid out with lots of artifacts from Ford's early life, through his time in the White House and up until his death. Staff was friendly and helpful and the museum was clean and well-maintained. They were also in the process of adding a large new display wing. Excited to see what that will contain when its finished.

What a great life! Fantastic museum for learning more about the history surrounding Gerald and Betty Fords Service to their country. The employees were helpful but not very friendly, luckily it’s a self guided tour.

This president museum is superb. Great presentation. We really enjoyed learning about the life and legacy of President Ford. He was a great man and the greatest president of the United States of America.

Besides that there is no parking lot for visitors, the staff and kids that go to this school are so humble and energetic. 

Their principle is caring and he has a cool vibe to his presence. I would volunteer here anytime!
Couldn't be happier with this school and the way they teach!! We love it!!
If you want an artsy kid, send them here. It was one of the best experiences in my life, and one of the most unique ones too.

I love the concept of an arts based school, especially since I'm an upcoming art teacher. However, when I came in to observe children create art, my colleague and I were treated like we were unwanted. While we were sent out of the office to wait, one of the (I believe teachers) were yelling at the kids in such a rude manor. Some of the teachers are wonderful on the other hand! I just wish I hadn't seen what I had that day. I didn't feel welcomed or wanted there. Please, be sure to really look into this school before putting your kids in it.
One of the best schools in grps.

I was here on a Saturday, when you can't make reservations (all other days of the week you can, I think), and it was pretty crowded so we had to wait about an hour to eat. But it was worth the wait! The tapas were delicious, and there was a huge variety to choose from. Would definitely recommend this place; I'm sure any meal here would be excellent. The decor is nice, too. Fun for a date!

Food was great, and our server Liz made the entire experience phenomenal. She was extremely fast, super friendly without being intrusive, and awesome at anticipating our needs, refilling our drinks... etc. before we even had to ask for anything. I would come here again, and ask to be seated in her section!

I'm giving this a one star because I never even got the chance to try the food. We arrived and we're promptly seated to our table as we reviewed the menus we did not noticed the minutes that flew by. We did notice however that we had not seen or heard our waitress/waiter offering greetings and/or a water. It has been 5 plus minutes at this point and another table who arrived after use was greeted and had waters at there tables. My wife and I thought... Maybe since we were looking at the menus the wait staff would not come up to our table, so we placed them at the furthest corner from us so we would appear to be ready for some service. A few more minutes went by and still no service, now, we were not seated it some dark corner of the room we're the waitress/waiter could not see us, we were right in front, in plain view of the wait staff. After 10 plus minutes my wife and I decided to leave and head to Grand Rapids Brewing Company which was only a hundred feet away (delicious brunch was served and excellent service). As my wife and I gathered our things and headed towards the door I presume the floor manager stopped us and asked if there was some sort of issue, I explained the wait we had, and since none of the wait staff had approached our table for some time, we had decided to leave. We thanked him for his curiosity at our departure and promptly left.

Was in the area for a conference, decided to stop and try out this Tapas Bistro. Good selection of food and they even had a separate Vegan Menu! Nice portions and prices, some good happy hour deals. Good quality of food and nothing was too greasy or heavy which is ideal when having tapas. Only 4 stars instead of 5 because there was nothing that put the experience over the top. Waitress was very pleasant but wasn't always on top of refills and had to wait quite awhile to even ask for our bill. Service was average but the food was great, will come back next time I'm in town

Food was very good! Service was awesome. We had a work party and they did a very good job with the group. Plus I have Celiac Disease and they mad sure to point out what I could eat with the rest of the table and offered to make me something off the gluten free choices if I wanted. The waiter even asked me if I got enough to eat. They also made me my own gluten free bread and it was awesome!

Pretty decent gyros for the price. Though if they shaved the meat thinner like a traditional gyro or Mediterranean kebab they would be even better. Great selection of toppings to go with. Place is a little dirty but what kebab shop isn't!?

Food is always amazing. I always have fresh food and the service is always great. It is in a trendy area and has a parking lot which is such a plus for the busy neighborhood. WIll continue to return and would recommend to a friend.

They serve really good halal shawarma that you can customize with veggies and sauces. Of which, the veggies are usually fresh and the unique cucumber sauce is really good. Service is usually fine and price is also agreeable as per the taste.
I just love their lamb me with that cucumber sauce it it Soo good. The only complaint is they should offer some kind of rebate or something.
Quality food, real taste, big portions! Turkish coffee was so delicious - we ordered extra portion right away! Definitely good place to eat!

Sad it is closing! Only got to visit once, but really enjoyed it. Portions were pretty big and the food was very good. Our server, Michael, was awesome and hopefully one day he will read this review. :p 

They are closing soon so make sure to visit if you haven't, but show up about an hour before you want to eat.

Can't complain about the food it is excellent. We have a large truck and their parking lot (the whole neighborhood) is meant for small cars 😋 so we had to park down the street. But you must try the carrot cake. Wife said the BLT was the best ever because the bread is fabulous. So sorry to hear that they will close in the future.

Took my special-diet elderly mother here for lunch, and she can't wait to come back again! Make sure to visit the deli- so many vegan and gluten-free, yummy options. Our waitress was just lovely, and our meal was delicious.  Now they just need to offer vegan cheese options and I will be ecstatic!

One of my favorite restaurants in Grand Rapids. The food here is fresh and amazing. Parking is tricky and always go earlier than you want to eat because they're often busy. The chocolate pudding is AMAZING!!!!

So many delicious vegan options! I came there expecting one or two veg friendly choices in the bakery but was absolutely thrilled to see that the majority of the case items (which are all beautiful) were an option for our family. Thank you for making vegan food that everyone can enjoy.

Expensive, but as long as you know that going in, you will have a good experience. Our server was great, very energetic and upbeat. The food was amazing! The wine was great! I don't think I've ever bought a bottle of wine before but totally with it today! Also, it's called Charley's Crab for a reason, get the crab!!!!

Very disappointing.  Food was greasy and small portions. Way over priced for the quality of food that was served. Waitress kept 'forgetting' everything. Brought me a drink that was horrible tasting and she said "oh yeah, I thought that didn't look right". We had to ask for silverware since she took ours. She took my mother's dinner plate without asking if she was finished eating. Parking lot was empty when we arrived. Should have taken that as a sign and left for ANY other place.

I had great service and the food was satisfactory. I just that for the same price I could go get much more better tasting seafood. The restaurant had great views of the grand river so I’ll go back to try their drinks at the bar.

Very nice place in downtown Grand Rapids, right on the Grand River. Great open atmosphere with lots of natural light. Has been around for decades and of all my visits, has never disappointed. It is expensive but, to be expected....as it is one of the "finer" seafood places in GR. However, Happy Hour is Awesome!! 3p-7p M-F and so many reasonably priced options. Huge drink selection. Our party tried many of the happy hour items including: titanic wedge skewers, queso & chips, shrimp dumplings, firecracker poppers (shrimp), and crispy smoked mozzarella. Table also experienced the king crab legs and the fresh oysters. Everything was exceptional! (The rolls, crackers, and salmon pate are amazing!!) Presentation is nice too. Our waitress, Christine, was great...All staff members were very friendly. 

Sunday Brunch is a MUST TRY at least once in your life. A little pricey but Definitely worth the experience (it has just about everything)! 

Charley's Crab is great for a date, celebration/special occasion, or just happy hour with friends.

Went for the first time as my son picked it out for his 21st birthday.  Delicious food, pleasant atmosphere, and excellent service.  They made it special for my family.  My son enjoyed his first Mojito and I enjoyed the mock-tail since I was driving.

The food was wonderful! Good size portions and affordable. The customer service was great. I was really impressed by the complimentary spring roll and cheese cake that came with my meal. Can't wait to go again.
Thai Express offers consistently delicious food and great prices. Today was busy but the food still came quickly. Easily one of my favorite restaurants in town!

It's hard to say which is better, the waitstaff or the food. Both are excellent. This is hands down my favorite Thai place. When eating at the other options in GR I often find myself regretting that I didn't just go to Thai Express instead. Definitely would recommend anyone to at least give it a chance.

Went with 5 others. We were not all served all the same time. My food was last to come out and everyone had already finished their meals. Had to get a to-go container. The inky rain is not a 1 or 2 star is the food was plentiful(when it arrived) and was delicious. Never had Thai before. My new favorite food is Pad Ce ew.
We love the question, "How hot?" and when they say hot... they mean it. Amazing price for the amount we ordered. Great service. Delicious authentic Thai food.

Twisted Rooster is an excellent option all around when looking for a lunch venue.  I was greeted by the door, seconds after entering.  Their service staff is friendly  professional and quick. The restaurant is very clean.  Their bathroom is easy to access, very clean and has modern amenities,  unlike some that look like they haven't been remodeled in decades. They have automatic paper towel dispensers which I like and the door opens out, so your hands stay clean. I had fish and chips which were amazing.  This has always been a popular place for very good food. I definitely recommended it highly.

Our server Adrian was very nice and attentive. My family and I were in town to celebrate my fiancé's birthday and found this place along the way. He ordered the Zip Chicken which was amazing, I ordered the fish tacos and we split the Simple Salad(cinnamon croutons😋) and they were also great. Ordered the MI Mai Thai and it was DELICIOUS! The only downside was the fried chicken entree, not much flavor but other than that, we will be back and I'll be ordering the Zip Chicken. Thanks again Adrian!!

Was there on Sunday, Saint Patty's Day and had the Zip Chicken.  My friend had the fish taco's and her young daughter had Mac & Cheese and a fruit cup.  Great dishes all around at a reasonable price for locally sourced food.  And the service from Adrian was very attentive!  Always a good experience here!
Sat at the bar rail. Megan was very attentive despite how busy it was. Food came out exceptionally quick and exceeded my expectations! Highly recommend for anyone headed down beltline!!

The drinks were amazing! 5 stars hand down for the drinks and the TR salad. The cinnamon croutons where a crunchy touch that my husband and I just loved! They will let you split a salad to enjoy before a meal. I had the lobster mac and cheese and my husband the breakfast burger. It was good but not as good as the TR salad, waffle nachos and drinks.

Nice and clean with sweet service. They lost a star from me because they took out the hot tub. This was a huge bummer for me since this is a ski town and there is nothing better than the hot tub after skiing all day. Also the breakfast doesn't provide a lot of gluten free and vegan options.

Stayed in a King and jacuzzi suite. Check-in took longer than usual and while standing in line the floors/ceilings must be super thin in addition to the guest staying above the main office being rude and stomping. I was worried I would have to deal with that for the night. Luckily we were given a room on the 3rd floor. The jacuzzi had a chip in it right where we were required to sit. The room had a good view and everything else went well. Overall would still recommend.

I’ve lived in Boone for about three years and stayed here for the first time tonight. The price was very reasonable and the service was outstanding! Kayla, the receptionist, was incredibly friendly while we booked our room. Love that it’s located near a couple local restaurants and a grocery store. Definitely recommend!
Clean room, friendly staff, great location. Thank you for your hospitality

We usually stay here when visiting App State. Nice, clean, close, with a helpful staff. Breakfast is decent.
The heart shaped tub in the room was hilarious! Wouldn't use it for fear off catching something!
